Description & Explanation: Add a drag-and-drop uploader in the Personal Vault for text files (up to 5MB). Checks file size and type for secure upload.
Example / Use Case: A user drags a 3MB text file (e.g., resume.txt) which is validated and uploaded to the vault.
Notes / Questions: Applies to all users for basic file management.

Feature: Privacy Confirmation Popup for File Uploads
Description & Explanation: Display a popup after upload stating “Encrypted with AES256, wiped after use—no traces left.” Log the action in the AuditLog.
Example / Use Case: A user uploads a file, sees the encryption confirmation, and the action is logged with timestamp and user ID.
Notes / Questions: Ensures user trust and auditing compliance.

Description & Explanation: Automatically tag uploaded text files with 10 keywords using the LLaMA model on SageMaker to improve file organization and search.
Example / Use Case: A text file about 'project planning' is tagged with keywords such as “project,” “planning,” “tasks,” and “deadlines.”
Notes / Questions: Enhances searchability and organization.

Description & Explanation: Update uploader to support PDFs (up to 5MB), parse citations within the PDF, and auto-tag with 10 keywords.
Example / Use Case: A user uploads a 4MB research paper PDF; LLaMA tags it with “research,” “study,” “citations” and extracts citation references.
Notes / Questions: Question: What exactly does “parse citations within the PDF” mean? (It involves extracting bibliographic/reference data.)

Feature: Extend File Uploader for Images with OCR
Description & Explanation: Support image files (.jpg, .png up to 5MB) by using AWS Rekognition for OCR to extract text, then auto-tag with 10 keywords via LLaMA.
Example / Use Case: A 2MB scanned image of a note is processed; extracted text 'Meeting Notes: Plan Q2' is tagged with “meeting,” “notes,” “Q2.”
Notes / Questions: Useful for digitizing scanned documents.

Description & Explanation: Allow .xlsx files (up to 5MB) by parsing data and auto-tagging with 10 keywords to help organize tabular data.
Example / Use Case: A 1MB spreadsheet with budget data is tagged with “budget,” “expenses,” “finance,” “data.”
Notes / Questions: Particularly for professionals handling financial/data-driven spreadsheets.

Feature: Extend File Uploader for Multi-Page Tables
Description & Explanation: Enable support for PDFs with multi-page tables (up to 5MB), parse tables, and auto-tag with 10 keywords.
Example / Use Case: A 3MB PDF with a 5-page sales data table is tagged with “sales,” “data,” “tables,” “revenue.”
Notes / Questions: Question: Need a method to decide when to use OCR vs. direct parsing (for scanned vs. editable PDFs).

Feature: Extend File Uploader for Embedded Charts
Description & Explanation: Detect and tag charts embedded in documents (e.g., PDFs up to 5MB) using 10 keywords via LLaMA.
Example / Use Case: A PDF containing an embedded bar chart of sales trends is tagged with “chart,” “sales,” “trends,” “visual.”
Notes / Questions: Aimed at professionals analyzing visual data.

Feature: Extend File Uploader for ABA Logs
Description & Explanation: Support .csv files for ABA logs (used in behavioral therapy) up to 5MB and auto-tag with 10 keywords.
Example / Use Case: A therapist uploads a 2MB ABA log; LLaMA tags it with “ABA,” “behavior,” “therapy,” “patient.”
Notes / Questions: Question: Need to review the structure of ABA logs (e.g., date, behavior type, frequency).

Feature: Deploy LLaMA Model on AWS SageMaker
Description & Explanation: Deploy the LLaMA 2 13B Chat model (or LLaMA 3.1 8B) on AWS SageMaker using JumpStart on an ml.g5.12xlarge instance. Create an endpoint (‘contextufy-llama-endpoint’).
Example / Use Case: LLaMA is deployed and an endpoint is created to process tagging requests.
Notes / Questions: Ensures secure and efficient AI processing for tagging and queries.

Description & Explanation: Add AES-256 encryption to all uploaded files before storing in S3 to secure user data.
Example / Use Case: A file is encrypted with AES-256 and then stored, ensuring only authorized access can decrypt it.
Notes / Questions: Critical for user data security and privacy.

Description & Explanation: Define and display the benefits of the Pro plan (e.g., unlimited AI insights, advanced sharing, priority support) on the subscription page.
Example / Use Case: The subscription page shows: 'Pro Plan: Unlimited AI insights, advanced sharing, priority support — $15/month.'
Notes / Questions: Encourages users to upgrade to the Pro tier.

Feature: Add Prompt Input for AI Queries
Description & Explanation: Add a text field labeled 'Ask Anything...' with a tooltip for users to input AI queries.
Example / Use Case: A user types 'Summarize my project notes' and sees the tooltip 'Ask anything!' on hover.
Notes / Questions: Enables core AI query functionality for all users.

Description & Explanation: Show a popup labeled 'AI Suggested Files' with 3 file suggestions (checkboxes) based on the user's prompt.
Example / Use Case: For the query 'Summarize my project plan,' LLaMA extracts keywords and suggests files like 'ProjectPlan.pdf,' 'Notes.txt,' 'Timeline.xlsx.'
Notes / Questions: Enhances accuracy and context of AI responses by pre-selecting relevant files.

Feature: Add Preview Popup for Suggested Files
Description & Explanation: Add a 'View' button in the AI Suggestion Popup to preview file content with highlighted tags.
Example / Use Case: A user clicks 'View' on 'ProjectPlan.pdf' and sees its content with highlighted tags before closing the popup.
Notes / Questions: Helps users choose the most relevant files for their query.

Feature: Add Select File Button for AI Queries
Description & Explanation: Add a 'Select File' button in the AI Suggestion Popup for users to confirm file selection for the query.
Example / Use Case: A user selects 'ProjectPlan.pdf' and 'Notes.txt' and clicks 'Select File' to include them in the AI query.
Notes / Questions: Ensures that only chosen files are processed by the AI.

Feature: Implement Context Summarization for AI Queries
Description & Explanation: Automatically summarize the content of a selected file to provide concise context for AI processing, displayed above the AI response.
Example / Use Case: A file ('ProjectPlan.pdf') is summarized as 'Project plan for Q2, includes tasks and deadlines' and shown above the AI’s answer.
Notes / Questions: Improves AI response accuracy for Pro and Enterprise users.

Feature: Display AI Response with Loading State
Description & Explanation: Show a loading spinner in the 'AI Response' area while processing the query, then display the final AI response.
Example / Use Case: A user submits a query and sees a spinner for 5 seconds before the response appears (e.g., 'Here’s a summary of your project plan...').
Notes / Questions: Enhances user experience during query processing.

Feature: Add Save Options for AI Responses
Description & Explanation: Add buttons for 'Save to Private' and 'Save to Community' in the AI Response area to allow users to save responses.
Example / Use Case: After receiving an AI response, a user clicks 'Save to Community' and the response is stored in the 'Team Notes' Community Vault.
Notes / Questions: Supports recordkeeping and collaboration by saving AI outputs.

Feature: Implement Meeting Notes Action Item Extractor Plug-In
Description & Explanation: Create a plug-in that extracts actionable items from meeting notes via a Lambda function.
Example / Use Case: Input: 'Discuss Q2 goals, assign tasks to John by Friday.' Output: 'Action Item: Assign tasks to John, Due: Friday.'
Notes / Questions: Helps Pro/Enterprise users automate task extraction from meeting notes.

Description & Explanation: Add a Budget Analyzer template in the Prompt Area to allow users to input financial data and receive an analysis.
Example / Use Case: A user inputs 'Rent: $1,000, Food: $300' and the plug-in outputs 'Total: $1,300, Rent: 77%, Food: 23%'
Notes / Questions: Aids financial planning for Pro and Enterprise users.

Description & Explanation: Create a plug-in for tracking expenses by category and date, outputting a categorized expense report via Lambda.
Example / Use Case: A user inputs 'Groceries: $50, 2025-04-20' and the plug-in outputs 'Groceries: $50, Total: $50'
Notes / Questions: Useful for expense tracking and financial management.

Description & Explanation: For ABA logs in CSV format, generate trend summaries and visualizations, saving output as a smart doc.
Example / Use Case: A therapist uploads a CSV ABA log with entries like 'Tantrum: 3 times, 2025-04-20' and receives a summary: 'Tantrum frequency: 3/day, Trend: Decreasing'
Notes / Questions: Question: Review the exact structure of ABA logs for accurate processing.

Description & Explanation: Automatically summarize AI sessions (prompt, response, files used) and save the summary for review.
Example / Use Case: For the query 'Summarize my project plan,' the session is summarized as 'Prompt: Summarize project plan, Files: ProjectPlan.pdf, Response: Key tasks and deadlines.'
Notes / Questions: Helps Pro/Enterprise users review past AI interactions.

Description & Explanation: Create a DynamoDB table and Lambda functions (RegisterPlugIn, ExecutePlugIn) for managing plug-in metadata and execution.
Example / Use Case: A plug-in 'Meeting Notes Extractor' is registered with metadata and later executed to process user inputs.
Notes / Questions: Enables extensibility by managing both pre-built and user-created plug-ins.

Feature: Add Manage Plug-Ins Section in Admin Page
Description & Explanation: Provide a UI for admins to upload and manage plug-ins with fields for metadata and scripts, and register via Lambda.
Example / Use Case: An admin uploads a new plug-in 'Task Extractor' with associated details and registers it.
Notes / Questions: Ensures controlled availability and management of plug-ins by tier.

Feature: Extend Templates Section to Support Dynamic Plug-Ins
Description & Explanation: Update the Templates section in the Prompt Area to dynamically list available plug-ins based on user tier and approval status.
Example / Use Case: A Pro user sees a 'Budget Analyzer' plug-in, inputs 'Rent: $1,000,' and the plug-in outputs 'Total: $1,000.'
Notes / Questions: Enhances usability by only displaying approved plug-ins for the user’s tier.

Description & Explanation: Add a 'Paste URL to Summarize' field in the Personal Vault, fetch HTML content, summarize, tag (3-5 keywords), and save as a smart doc.
Example / Use Case: A user pastes 'https://example.com/article' and receives a summary tagged with 'article,' 'news,' 'example.'
Notes / Questions: Facilitates quick summarization and organization of web content.

Description & Explanation: Add a 'Save to Contextufy Vault' button in a Chrome extension popup to capture URL, title, and HTML, sending it to the webclip endpoint.
Example / Use Case: A user right-clicks on a webpage and selects 'Save to Contextufy Vault,' receiving a 'Web page saved' notification.
Notes / Questions: Enhances ease of capturing online content directly from the browser.

Description & Explanation: Add a 'Sync Library' button in the Personal Vault to authenticate with Zotero/Mendeley, select a library, auto-tag, and import items.
Example / Use Case: A researcher syncs 10 .bib files which are then tagged with 'research' and 'references.'
Notes / Questions: Specific to researchers managing reference libraries.

Description & Explanation: Add a field to paste a LinkedIn Profile URL, fetch and summarize profile data, and save as a smart doc.
Example / Use Case: A user pastes a LinkedIn URL and gets a summary like 'John Doe, Software Engineer, 5 years experience.'
Notes / Questions: Useful for professionals networking or researching contacts.

Description & Explanation: Add an 'Import from Google Drive' button in the Personal Vault to authenticate, select files, auto-tag, and save them.
Example / Use Case: A user imports a PDF from Google Drive, which is tagged with 'document' and 'Google.'
Notes / Questions: Simplifies bringing existing documents into the platform.

Description & Explanation: Add a 'Link Email Inbox' button to sync Gmail/Outlook, set sync frequency, import emails, summarize, tag, and save as smart docs.
Example / Use Case: A user links their Gmail account, and daily emails are imported and summarized (e.g., 'Meeting invite: 2025-05-10').
Notes / Questions: Helps manage email-based information on the platform.

Description & Explanation: Add a 'Calendar Feed' section in the Personal Vault to upload .ics files or connect a calendar, parse dates, and generate a timeline smart doc.
Example / Use Case: A lawyer uploads an .ics file and receives a smart doc: 'Timeline: Hearing on 2025-06-01.'
Notes / Questions: Specific to legal professionals managing court schedules.

Description & Explanation: Stress-test the platform with 100+ simulated users, optimizing performance with caching and responsive design.
Example / Use Case: A simulation with 100 users uploading files and asking AI queries confirms the platform maintains performance.
Notes / Questions: Ensures scalability and performance for the official launch.
